com.xith3d.render
Interface Shader

All Superinterfaces:
StateSortable
All Known Implementing Classes:
ColoringShader, FogShader, FragmentProgramShader, LightingShader, LineAttrShader, MaterialShader, PolygonAttrShader, RenderingShader, TextureAttrShader, TextureShader, TransformShader, TransparencyShader, VertexProgramShader
public interface Shader
extends StateSortable

A shader is what is responsible for setting up the graphics state to render an atom. Shaders can be compared to other shaders in order to sort them in an efficient manner.

Each shader needs to have an API peer which is capable of issuing the proper commands to the 3d card. Thus the shader really is a container for the information needed to shade, but the implementation of the shader is within the hardware interface layer.

Method Summary
 boolean isTranslucent()
          Because the rendering engine needs to deal with translucent geometry differently the shader needs to be able to indicate whether it is translucent or not
